Event: Summer of Opportunity
Address: Columbus Park; 500 S. Central Ave., Chicago, IL
Description: The City of Chicago is facing some very challenging times in navigating the issue of youth violence. Our elected leaders, along with many of our community organizations, are working together to address the ongoing, and senseless tragedies. As part of that commitment, we are working alongside many community agencies and corporate partners on a free community event called, Summer of Opportunity, set for Friday June 22nd.

Event: Chicago Moves Day at Federal Plaza
Description: Chicago Moves Day is a citywide initiative to motivate Chicagoans of all ages to get moving. This event will highlight the many fitness and wellness opportunities across the city through workouts on the main stage, fitness and health screenings, nutrition and product sampling, and more! Our goal as an organization is to raise awareness among the residents of Chicago about taking small steps to make physical health both a priority and a habit.

Event: 27th Ward's 24th Annual Stay In School Picnic
Description:
The 27th Ward’s 24th Annual “Stay In School Picnic” is quickly approaching, and we’re hoping that you’re just as excited as we are! 
It will be a day full of family-friendly activities, lots of food and giveaway’s, entertainment, and those returning to school will receive a book bag with supplies and tools to help them succeed during the school year.



This year we’re kicking off the event off with a Parade.

Event: Chicago Department of Public Health Bi-Annual STI Conference
Description: This is a FREE one-day advanced continuing education program on sexually transmitted infection (STI) prevention geared towards healthcare providers. Leaders in public health and STI prevention will discuss trending topics of local and national importance, including STI epidemiology, congenital syphilis elimination, adolescent health, clinical and laboratory considerations for syphilis and much more.

Event: Clean Slate Summit
Address: XS Tennis Village 5336 S. StateChicago, IL 60609
Description: The Sky Cares Foundation presented by Magellan Corporation has joined forces with the Cook County Circuit Court Clerk and the Juvenile Probation Department to host the Clean Slate Summit, a first-of-its-kind youth-focused event that provides Chicago’s underserved youth the necessary resources, legal guidance, and mentorship to petition to expunge their arrest and court records and be provided an equal opportunity for a successful future.

Get moving! has something for everyone.

Event: Build's 2018 Celebration Dinner
Address: Radisson Blu: Aqua221 N. Columbus Drive, Chicago, IL
Description: We invite you to join us this year at BUILD’s Celebration Dinner! BUILDing Opportunity, Transforming the Future. We will be honoring the hard work of thousands of Chicago’s youth who, thanks to BUILD, are moving from despair to hope, and from dropping out of school to becoming young leaders. We would be so grateful for your leadership gift and presence at this very special event. Cost per person see below.

Event: The Time is Now - Sistas Uplifting Sistas on Health Equity, PrEP and Dismantling Racism
Description:
Commemorating National Women & Girls HIV/AIDS Awareness Day 
The one-day conference will focus on identifying the combined impact of racism, trauma, and inequalities on the health outcomes of women and girls. Taking into consideration these factors, conference participants will gather information, tools, support, and affirmation to both confront systemic barriers and to consider solutions and strategies to improve HIV programming specifically for women and girls, inclusive of transgender persons.
This event is FREE! RSVP by March 12
